aliens.name: Edgar the Bug
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, disguised by wearing the skin of an abusive farmer named Edgar
special_notes: Main antagonist in the first Men in Black film.
Resembles a cockroach, praying mantis, cricket, grasshopper, and hornet.
Driven by a deep hatred for the killing of insects.
Seeks the Arquilian Galaxy.
Abilities include heightened intellect, super strength, super flexibility, wall crawling, super leaping, vocal camouflage, and slime secretion.

aliens.name: Boris The Animal
aliens.species: Baglodite. Last surviving member of the race.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes. Was sent to Earth in the 1960s.
special_notes: Intergalactic criminal and main antagonist in Men in Black 3.
Ruthless, violent, cunning, and intolerant of failure.
His planet, Bagladeshia, is 20 light years away from Earth.
Accompanied by a small insect-like pet called "the Weasel" which provides lethal spikes.
Imprisoned in Lunar Max prison.

aliens.name: The Worms
aliens.dangerous: False. Tend to panic and cry out rather than fight.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes. They moved into an apartment in New York and can be found in break rooms and coffee houses.
special_notes: Provide comic relief.
Have a strong affinity for coffee, which is considered a Noble's drink among them.
Physically, they have two primary arms, six tiny arms on their chest, antennas, and three-toed feet.
Might have the ability to regenerate, as they are spineless.

aliens.name: Serleena
aliens.dangerous: True. Ruthless and devours those who cross her path.
aliens.size_or_height: Shape-shifting (Appears as a human model, initially a serpent).
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes. Arrived in New York seeking the Light of Zartha.
aliens.age: Spent years searching for the Light of Zartha
special_notes: Main antagonist in Men in Black 2.
Engaged in a long-standing war with the Zarthans.
Abilities include shape-shifting. She infiltrated MIB headquarters.

aliens.name: Arquillians (Arkhilians)
aliens.dangerous: False. Key allies to MIB.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, they can hide within human-like exosuits.
special_notes: Known for their large heads and eyes.
Guardians of the Arquilian Galaxy, which is a small sphere.
Possess advanced technology and knowledge.

aliens.name: C-18 Locker Aliens
aliens.dangerous: False. Described as innocent and gullible.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, hidden within Locker C-18.
special_notes: Covered with brown fur, big eyes, and antennas that glow like a bioluminescent disco.
Have a habit of collective chanting/synchronized harmonies.
They worship everyday objects.

aliens.name: Frank the Pug
aliens.dangerous: False. Described as a troublemaker with a heart of gold.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, cleverly disguised as a pug to blend in on Earth.
special_notes: A talking dog.
Worked as Agent J's partner in the second movie.
Gave crucial information about the Arquilian Galaxy in the first film.

aliens.name: Ballchinian
aliens.dangerous: True (Adversary of MIB, recruited by Serleena).
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes (Appears disguised as human).
special_notes: Possess an unconventional feature resembling a pair of testicles dangling from their chins.
While resilient to most attacks, their chin balls are their weak spot.

aliens.name: Archanans
aliens.dangerous: False. Wise beings. Griffin is the last known survivor.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes (The last survivor, Griffin, lives on Earth).
special_notes: Transcend the boundaries of three-dimensional existence.
Possess the ability to perceive an infinite array of alternate timelines and potential futures.
Their home planet, Ark, was destroyed by the Boglodites.
Griffin safeguarded the Arcnet Shield.

aliens.name: Bicranials
aliens.dangerous: Unknown/Neutral.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes (Can be mistaken for humans).
special_notes: Possess a secondary head, smaller in size, emerging from a flexible neck extending from their backs.
The secondary head has independent consciousness but limited control over the body.

aliens.name: Jara
aliens.dangerous: True. Intergalactic criminal mastermind.
aliens.size_or_height: True form is a micro-sized alien/miniature Flying Saucer.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes (Was captured and held at MIB HQ for over five years).
special_notes: Secondary antagonist in MIB 2.
Highly intelligent, driven by power and wealth.
Plotted to rob Earth's ozone layer.
Uses deceptive tactics, hiding many clones beneath his coat.

aliens.name: Jeff
aliens.dangerous: True. Wreaks havoc in the subway system.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes (Lives in the subway).
special_notes: Has a flower on his head which, when tampered with, provokes him.
Died after his body was used as a host by the villain Serleena.

aliens.name: Jack Jeeves
aliens.dangerous: Ambiguous. Known for shady dealings and illegal trade of alien technology/weapons.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, poses as a pawn shop owner.
special_notes: Has green blood.
Unique ability: can regenerate his head after it is shot off, though the regenerated head never looks the same.
Valuable resource for Agents K and J.

aliens.name: Bivoids
aliens.dangerous: Unknown/Neutral. Their home planet was destroyed by the Boglodites.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes (Resembles humans).
special_notes: Share a striking resemblance to humans, but have an unusually large skull and purple colored blood.

aliens.name: Cephaloids
aliens.dangerous: True. Threatening adversaries due to enhanced speed and stamina.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, can assume human form on Earth.
special_notes: True appearance unknown, but traits suggest a potential aquatic or fish-like nature (pulsating eyes and ability to breathe through gills).
Known for impressive leaping abilities.

aliens.name: Post Office Aliens
aliens.dangerous: False.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, disguised as a letter sorting machine in Massachusetts.
special_notes: Peach-skinned beings with **eight arms**.
Possess exceptional speed and coordination, performing multiple tasks simultaneously.

aliens.name: Zarthans
aliens.dangerous: False. Protective of their homeworld.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, can assume human guise.
special_notes: True appearance remains undisclosed.
Possess the "Light of Zartha," a powerful protective entity for their planet.

aliens.name: Mikey
aliens.dangerous: True. Escaped from prison and exhibited aggression.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, attempted to disguise himself as an immigrant.
special_notes: Appearance resembles a humanoid combination of a bullfrog and a crocodile.
Features include a shell-like structure, six small arms, and an elongated face with extendable shark-like jaws.

aliens.name: The Hive
aliens.dangerous: Extreme True. Their specialty is invading planets and merging with DNA to devour worlds.
aliens.earth_habitat: Attempted invasion in 2016 (failed). Can possess other species (e.g., High T).
special_notes: Their attempted invasion used the Eiffel Tower's Wormhole.

aliens.name: Pawny
aliens.dangerous: False. Loyal friend and protector to Agent M.
aliens.size_or_height: Small in size, resembles pawn pieces.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes (Serves Agent M on Earth).
special_notes: Charismatic, eccentric, and serves as comic relief.
Wears weird armor which he utilizes as a protective shell.

aliens.name: The Twins
aliens.species: Diad (Extinct, wiped out by The Hive).
aliens.dangerous: Ambiguous. Initially perceived as a threat (assassinated Fungus), but their goal was noble (to destroy The Hive).
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes (Appeared in London and on Reza stavrosa's Island).
special_notes: Highly intelligent and near invulnerable.
Unique ability to transform between **solid, liquid, and gas forms**.

aliens.name: Mr. Wu
aliens.dangerous: Ambiguous. Involved in illegal activities (unlicensed fish, health violations, associated with assassins).
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, owned a Chinese restaurant.
special_notes: Attempted to deceive Agents K and J with a fake accent.
His ultimate fate is uncertain due to the alteration of the 1969 timeline.

aliens.name: White Brain Guy
aliens.dangerous: Unknown.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes, visited Earth.
special_notes: Most striking feature is its unique appearance: a floating brain enclosed in a transparent dome.
Mysterious character.

aliens.name: Stalk Eyes
aliens.dangerous: True. Criminal who crossed paths and confronted MIB agents.
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes (Encountered at Wu's restaurant).
special_notes: Appearance resembles a combination of a lobster and a reptile.
Distinguishing feature: a set of large **stalk-like eyes**.

aliens.name: Dog Poop
aliens.dangerous: True (Adversary of MIB, neutralized by Agent K).
aliens.earth_habitat: Yes (Appeared on Earth seeking K).
special_notes: Distinct appearance that resembles a canine organic byproduct.
Has leathery skin and a prominent black nose.
